item.title: read add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Hell is—other people!" -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: read add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Human speech is like a cracked kettle on which we tap crude rhythms for bears to dance to, while we long to make music that will melt the stars." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: read add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "If you go home with somebody, and they don't have books, don't fuck 'em!" -- John Waters

item.title: read add a quote by Voltaire
item.description:
"I have never made but one prayer to God, a very short one: Oh Lord, make my enemies ridiculous. And God granted it."
(<i>Letter to Étienne Noël Damilaville</i>, May 16, 1767)" -- Voltaire

item.title: read add a quote by Scott Adams
item.description: "I love you like a fat kid loves cake!" -- Scott Adams

item.title: read add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: read add a quote by Ratty (Wind in the Willows)
item.description: "There is nothing, absolutely nothing so much worth doing as messing around in boats." -- Ratty (Wind in the Willows)

item.title: read add a quote by Matt Groening
item.description: "Love is a snowmobile racing across the tundra and then suddenly it flips over, pinning you underneath. At night, the ice weasels come." -- Matt Groening

item.title: read add a quote by Tove Jansson
item.description: "It looks rather ordinary," said the Snork. "Unless you consider that a top hat is always somewhat extraordinary, of course." -- Tove Jansson

item.title: read add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "In heaven, all the interesting people are missing." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: read add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "I hadn't the heart to touch my breakfast. I told Jeeves to drink it himself." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: read add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "Mr Leopold Bloom ate with relish the inner organs of beasts and fowls. He liked thick giblet soup, nutty gizzards, a stuffed roast heart, liverslices fried with crustcrumbs, fried hencods' roes. Most of all he liked grilled mutton kidneys which gave to his palate a fine tang of faintly scented urine." -- James Joyce

item.title: read add a quote by Fran Lebowitz
item.description: "My favorite animal is steak." -- Fran Lebowitz

item.title: read add a quote by Isak Dinesen
read add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: read add a quote by Britney Spears
item.description: "I get to go to overseas places, like Canada." -- Britney Spears

item.title: read add a quote by Jean-Luc Godard
item.description: "All you need to make a movie is a girl and a gun." -- Jean-Luc Godard

item.title: read add a quote by Voltaire
read add a quote by Eric Cantona
item.description: "When the seagulls follow the trawler, it is because they think sardines will be thrown into the sea. " -- Eric Cantona

item.title: read add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Mother died today. Or maybe yesterday; I can't be sure." -- Albert Camus

item.title: read add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "Love me. Love my umbrella." -- James Joyce

item.title: read add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: read add a quote by Henning Mankell
read add a quote by Anthony Bourdain
item.description:
"Vegetarians, and their Hezbollah-like splinter-faction, the vegans, are a persistent irritant to any chef worth a damn.
To me, life without veal stock, pork fat, sausage, organ meat, demi-glace, or even stinky cheese is a life not worth living.
Vegetarians are the enemy of everything good and decent in the human spirit, an affront to all I stand for, the pure enjoyment of food. The body, these waterheads imagine, is a temple that should not be polluted by animal protein. It's healthier, they insist, though every vegetarian waiter I've worked with is brought down by any rumor of a cold.
Oh, I'll accomodate them, I'll rummage around for something to feed them, for a 'vegetarian plate', if called on to do so. Fourteen dollars for a few slices of grilled eggplant and zucchini suits my food cost fine." -- Anthony Bourdain
